news_header: Finns are leading in recycled clothing purchases, according to a Statista survey.
news_text: A recent Statista consumer survey revealed that 30% of respondents in Finland purchased used clothes in the past year, placing Finland at the top alongside Poland among 21 countries. Sweden and the United States had a 30% recycling rate, while South Korea and Japan had the lowest at 10%. The overall average for all respondents was 23%. The survey, conducted from October 2023 to September 2024, included 1,259 to 10,109 participants aged 18-64.
